text: My name is Mallik Rao,

Chief Technology and Information Officer
for Telefonica in Germany.

The vision for me is, telecom
is good in adopting,

but we are not good
at disrupting ourselves,

and that is something cloud
as a technology

was really attractive for us,
which disrupts ourselves

in terms of technology, in terms
of operating model, in terms of culture.

So these are the three essential elements
for me when we started on this
whole journey of cloud.
at the core of telecom.
We've been working with AWS to

bring core functions of telecom
onto public cloud.
It took, of course,

three years for us to go there, bringing
the services quicker to the market,
innovating on services.

That was the primary reason for us
and of course working with AWS

and in this case with Nokia on the packet
core software for the 5G standalone (core).

The outcome for the customer,
what we were trying to drive with

this solution is:
How can you scale quickly?
How can you deploy software

in service upgrades
and also innovate the services,

when we been connecting the 
core network with the internet.

However, if you want to go with 5G
standalone, 5G advanced,  low latency

applications, and that's where we want
to be quickly to the time to market.

What I really like working with AWS
is it has agility at the core of it,

because the journey when we started off,
the public cloud was not ready

for taking  the telecom applications;
and then the agility of AWS
was really impressive.

And that's where I felt very confident
that I can take the core of my systems
into public cloud

its agility,
its nimbleness and also learning.

And it took three years
for both of us to really learn.

And today we have a million customers
working
live in the Frankfurt region.

I get more and more confident
that I can move millions of customers
onto this platform.
What we have last two and a half years.
